message.content:
To copy the contents of a cell and remove all single quotes, you can use the following formula in LibreOffice Calc:

=SUBSTITUTE(A1,"'","")

Replace A1 with the reference to the cell that contains the value with single quotes. This formula uses the SUBSTITUTE function to replace all occurrences of a single quote ('') with an empty string ("").

Alternatively, you can also use the TEXT function:

=TEXT(A1,"@")

This formula will remove any formatting from the cell, including single quotes, and return just the value.
